title: Rapid Blaster Pro Deco
content:
The Rapid Blaster Pro Deco is a main weapon in the Splatoon series. It is the Deco-branded version of the Rapid Blaster Pro.

The Rapid Blaster Pro Deco is nearly identical in appearance to the Rapid Blaster Pro. The only difference between the two is that the Rapid Blaster Pro Deco has stickers bearing the Deco logo on the sides. In Splatoon 3, the detailing on the weapon body is also blue instead of red.

The Rapid Blaster Pro Deco was released on 25 December 2015 at 02:00 UTC.[1] It is identical to the Rapid Blaster Pro but comes with Disruptors and the Killer Wail.

- The Rapid Blaster Pro Deco is a middleweight weapon.

- Each shot consumes 10% of the ink tank capacity.
This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- When firing continuously, it shoots a bullet every 40 frames (1.5 shots per second).

- When firing while moving, the player's movement speed is set to 0.57 units per frame.

- After firing, there is a 20 frame cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.

- Each shot has a base damage of 80.

- Shots travel straight for 11 frames.

- Shots have a radius of 2 units.

- Shots cannot ever deviate from the inner reticle while on the ground.

- The angle its shots can deviate while in the air is 5 degrees.

- The outer reticle immediately expands after jumping. The outer reticle will finish shrinking after 60 frames.

- When jumping, the chance to shoot towards the outer reticle instead of the inner reticle is immediately set to 40%.

- Shots initially travel straight at a rate of 14 units per frame for 11 frames. Shots travel straight for 154 distance units.

- Ink droplets occur every 15 units.

- The frequency at which ink drips from a shot occurs at a rate of 12 droplets per shot.

- There are a total of 1 different droplet patterns that can be created while firing this weapon.

- Droplets that occur within 11 units of the player have a radius of 19.2 units.

- Droplets that occur when they travel past 200 units of the player have a radius of 18 units.

- All other ink droplets have a radius of 11.5 units.

- The shot explodes 15 frames after being fired.

- The far damage radius of the explosion is 35 units.

- When the shot explodes on the ground or wall, the far damage radius is 17.5 units.

- The near damage radius of the explosion is 5 units.

- Damage from the explosion scales from 25 at the far damage radius to 80 at the near damage radius.

- When the shot explodes on the ground or wall, the damage scales from 12.5 at the far damage radius to 40 at the near damage radius.

- When the shot explodes in the air, it creates a splash of paint with a radius of 28 units.

- The wall impact painting radius is 17 units.

- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

[2]

- ▲ Special gauge loss: 50% → 40%.

- ▲ Movement speed while firing increased by about 15%.

- ▲ Spread when player is jumping reduced by about 50%.

The Rapid Blaster Pro Deco may be a bit of a mouthful, but it's worth it for that snazzy decoration! Its stats match the Rapid Blaster Pro's, but it includes Disruptors to weaken your foes before you splat them! Oh, and your Killer Wail can restrict them even more! Give this set a try if that's your sort of thing.(NA/EU/OC)

- Promotional image.

- Holding the Rapid Blaster Pro Deco.

- Running with the Rapid Blaster Pro Deco.

- Firing. (front)

- Firing. (back)

- Official art of an Inkling holding the Rapid Blaster Pro Deco.

- SplatNet icon

The Rapid Blaster Pro Deco was released on 1 June 2018 at 00:00 UTC.[3] It comes with Splash Walls and the Ink Armor.

- The Rapid Blaster Pro Deco is a middleweight weapon.

- The matchmaking range is 192. The game's matchmaking system looks at a team's average matchmaking range value, and matches them against a team with a similar average.

- The ink consumption of 8% and ink tank capacity of 100% allows players to fire 12 shots before needing to refill the ink supply.
This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- When initially firing the weapon in humanoid form, the first shot takes 12 frames to come out.

- When firing from swim form, the first shot takes 21 frames to come out.

- The interval between firing and when the player is able to enter swim form or use a sub weapon is 20 frames.

- When firing continuously, it shoots a bullet every 40 frames (1.5 shots per second).

- When firing while moving, the player's movement speed is set to 0.5 units per frame.

- After firing, there is a 50 frame cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.

- Each shot has a base damage of 85.

- The bullet hitbox has a radius of 2 units.

- Shots cannot ever deviate from the inner reticle while on the ground.

- The angle its shots can deviate while in the air is 8 degrees.

- The outer reticle immediately expands after jumping. After 40 frames, the outer reticle will start shrinking, and will finish shrinking after 70 frames.

- When jumping, the chance to shoot towards the outer reticle instead of the inner reticle is immediately set to 50%.

- Shots initially travel straight at a rate of 14 units per frame for 11 frames. Shots travel straight for 154 distance units.
After that, the shot's velocity is set to 13.426 units per frame if it is not already lower than the listed value, and decreases further as it travels.

- After that, the shot's velocity is set to 13.426 units per frame if it is not already lower than the listed value, and decreases further as it travels.

- Ink droplets occur every 16.2 units.

- The frequency at which ink drips from a shot occurs at a rate of 12 droplets per shot.

- There are a total of 1 different droplet patterns that can be created while firing this weapon.

- Ink droplets have a radius of 11 units.

- Droplets have their radius multiplied by a value ranging from 1 if they fell from a height above 100 units to 1.2 if they fell from a height below 30 units.

- The shot explodes 15 frames after being fired.

- The far damage radius of the explosion is 33 units.
Main Power Up increases the far damage radius up to 35 units.

- Main Power Up increases the far damage radius up to 35 units.

- When the shot explodes on the ground or wall, the far damage radius is 16.5 units.

- The near damage radius of the explosion is 9.4 units.
Main Power Up increases the near damage radius up to 10 units.

- Main Power Up increases the near damage radius up to 10 units.

- Damage from the explosion is 35. Damage does not change based on distance from the center of the explosion.

- When the shot explodes on the ground or wall, the damage is 17.5.

- When the shot explodes in the air, it creates a splash of paint with a radius of 28 units.

- The radius of wall dripping paint is 10 units.

- The wall impact painting radius is 19 units.

- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- After that, the shot's velocity is set to 13.426 units per frame if it is not already lower than the listed value, and decreases further as it travels.

- Main Power Up increases the far damage radius up to 35 units.

- Main Power Up increases the near damage radius up to 10 units.

[4][5]

- ▼ Decreased radius of damage dealt by exploding shots by roughly 6%: 35 units → 33 units.

- ▲ The Main Power Up gear ability will now also increase the radius of explosions while equipped when using these main weapons.
The above effect will be maxed out when 2.9 times the normal amount of gear ability is equipped.
Each additional gear ability is worth 0.3 of the effect of the base gear ability.

- The above effect will be maxed out when 2.9 times the normal amount of gear ability is equipped.

- Each additional gear ability is worth 0.3 of the effect of the base gear ability.

- The above effect will be maxed out when 2.9 times the normal amount of gear ability is equipped.

- Each additional gear ability is worth 0.3 of the effect of the base gear ability.

- ▲ Increased damage dealt to the Rainmaker barrier by roughly 11%: 1.9x → 2.1x.

The Rapid Blaster Pro Deco is a Rapid Blaster Pro emblazoned with decorations from professional... decoration-ers! It has the same stats, but the Splash Wall sub lets you push out the front lines and set up shop! AND THAT'S NOT ALL! The Ink Armor special gives teammates the courage they need to join you in the heat of battle! This set is recommended for aggressive players who can manage their range!

- Promotional image

The Rapid Blaster Pro Deco returns in Splatoon 3 as part of the Sizzle Season 2023 update on 1 June 2023. The weapon received an official Twitter post from Nintendo on 22 May 2023 and its Tableturf card has been shown in the update's trailer posted by Nintendo. Its kit is the Angle Shooter and Killer Wail 5.1. Its visual appearance is like that of the Rapid Blaster Deco, but their physical appearances are different.

- The Rapid Blaster Pro Deco is a middleweight weapon.

- The matchmaking range is 19.2. The game's matchmaking system looks at a team's average matchmaking range value, and matches them against a team with a similar average.

- The ink consumption is 8% per shot, allowing the user to fire 12 shots on a full ink tank.

- When firing continuously, it shoots a bullet every 40 frames (1.5 shots per second).

- When firing from humanoid form, the first shot takes 12 frames to come out. When firing from swim form, the first shot takes 21 frames to come out.

- The interval between firing the weapon and being able to enter swim form or use a sub weapon is 20 frames.

- When firing while moving, the player's movement speed is set to 0.05 units per frame.

- After firing, there is a 50 frame cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.

- The damage on direct hit is 85.

- The blast has a radius of 3.3 units and deals 35 damage.

- The bullet hitbox for collisions with players has a radius of 0.2 units.

- The bullet hitbox for collisions with the environment has a radius of 0.2 units.

- Shots cannot ever deviate from the inner reticle while on the ground.

- The angle its shots can deviate while in the air is 8.0 degrees.

- The outer reticle immediately expands after jumping. After 40 frames, the outer reticle will start shrinking, and will finish shrinking after 70 frames.

- When jumping, the chance to shoot towards the outer reticle instead of the inner reticle is immediately set to 50%.

- Shots initially travel straight at a rate of 1.4 units per frame for 11 frames. Shots travel straight for 15.4 distance units.
After that, the shot's velocity is set to 1.3426 units per frame if it is not already lower than the listed value, and it loses 36% of its speed every frame (including the first frame after it stops traveling straight). Once the shot velocity decreases below a certain threshold, it will begin to be slowed less and fall faster.

- After that, the shot's velocity is set to 1.3426 units per frame if it is not already lower than the listed value, and it loses 36% of its speed every frame (including the first frame after it stops traveling straight). Once the shot velocity decreases below a certain threshold, it will begin to be slowed less and fall faster.

- The bullet explodes 15 frames after being fired, covering a total distance of about 17.59 units.
This number may vary at different firing angles.

- This number may vary at different firing angles.

- After that, the shot's velocity is set to 1.3426 units per frame if it is not already lower than the listed value, and it loses 36% of its speed every frame (including the first frame after it stops traveling straight). Once the shot velocity decreases below a certain threshold, it will begin to be slowed less and fall faster.

- This number may vary at different firing angles.

[6]

- ▼ Points to fill special gauge: 180 → 190.

The Rapid Blaster Pro Deco is a Rapid Blaster Pro that's been spiffed up by top designers and paired with a new loadout. You'll get the same performance you're used to, but with the Angle Shooter sub, it's easier than ever to take out distant foes. And having the Killer Wail 5.1 special in your back pocket to clean up loose ends is always a treat. No one can escape the wail! This isn't the best set for up-close-and-personal splatting, but give it a try if you like to keep your distance in battle!

- Promotional render

- The bottom right card is for the Rapid Blaster Pro Deco

- 2D icon.

- The Tableturf Battle card icon of the Rapid Blaster Pro Deco.

The difference between the three versions of the Rapid Blaster Pro: The Rapid Blaster Pro Deco is the only one whose lights do not illuminate when fired. (link to file)

For competitive tips about the Rapid Blaster Pro Deco

- In Splatoon 3, the lights on the sides of the Rapid Blaster Pro Deco does not illuminate when fired, but the others versions of the weapon does. This issue can also be seen on the Rapid Blaster Deco.
